document.heading: Home Purchase Assistance Step Up Fund Act of 1998

history.narrative: Law 12-266, the “Home Purchase Assistance Step Up Fund Act of 1998,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-661, which was referred to the Committee on Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 1, 1998, and December 15, 1998, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 23, 1998, it was assigned Act No. 12-574 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-266 became effective on April 27, 1999.
